pageContext.description: Socket penetrates to 80mm, i.e. to site of section only. Metal at lip is 1.5-2mm
pageContext.patina: Very lustrous patina dark blackish green.
pageContext.surface: Well preserved. 2 pits on reverse, small one in socket near top, longer near base of wing. A very small pit at tip of socket on face drawn.
pageContext.other: Thickness: at base of blade 14mm; socket 21mm,Weight: 3 3/4 oz = 106.31 gms
pageContext.collection: G.B. Bull,Gable Cottage, 30 Swan Shed, Kingsclere, Newbury
pageContext.site: England,Wiltshire,Winterslow,Lopscombe Corner (junction of Salisbury-Andover and Winchester Roads),Found by W.A. Smith of Spire View, Pitton, Salisbury, on newly-ploughed land never cultivated within living memory,"on the surface near an ancient war trench",18th February, 1943.
pageContext.toSearch: Lopcombe Corner, Salisbury, Wiltshire Sp5, UK
